definition: qin and se, two string instruments that play in perfect harmony/marital harmony
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither
a type of standing harp, smaller than konghou 箜篌, with 5-25 strings
out of tune/marital discord, cf qin and se 琴瑟, two string instruments as symbol of marital harmony
in perfect harmony/in sync/lit. qin and se sing in harmony

sentences.english: But harps resonance, but not and undiminished.
sentences.chinese: 而是琴瑟共鸣，却非相和之曲。

sentences.english: Take the plough and the forge and the mallet and the lute
sentences.chinese: 带着犁耙和炼炉，极棒和琴瑟。

sentences.english: These two air signs will hum together in life, through the ups and downs.
sentences.chinese: 这两个风象星座会在生活的起起伏伏中琴瑟和鸣。

definition: in perfect harmony/in sync/lit. qin and se sing in harmony
reed-pipe wind instrument and vertical bamboo flute
traditional Chinese musical instruments/music
reeds of a panpipe
to play the zither/classical variant of 彈琴|弹琴[tan2 qin2]
guzheng or long zither/long zither with 13 to 16 strings, developed from guqin 古琴 during Tang and Song times/Japanese koto
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
konghou (Chinese harp)
musical note/tone
tuning/temperament

to play the xiao 簫|箫[xiao1] (mouth organ)/to beg while playing pipes; cf politician Wu Zixu 伍子胥[Wu3 Zi3 xu1], c. 520 BC destitute refugee in Wu town, 吳市吹簫|吴市吹箫[Wu2 shi4 chui1 xiao1]/to busk/virtuoso piper wins a beauty, cf 玉人吹簫|玉人吹箫[yu4 ren2 chui1 xiao1]/(slang) fellatio/blowjob
to sing to a string accompaniment/education (a reference to teaching the people Confucian values by means of song in ancient times)
pipa, Chinese lute, with 4 strings, a large pear-shaped body and a fretted fingerboard
antiphon (i.e. solo voice answered by chorus)/sung reply (in agreement with first voice)/to reply with a poem in the same rhythm
to perform music (as an ensemble)
(phonetics) voiceless sound
